0.text: Innate - Rage Gene:  Mini Gnar generates 4 / 7 / 11 (based on level)  Rage over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving damage. Against non-champions, basic attacks and  Boomerang Throw instantly generate「 0.5 / 0.875 / 1.375 (based on level) Rage. 」「 12.5% of the amount. 」 Against champions,  Boomerang Throw instantly generates「 1 / 1.75 / 2.75 (based on level) Rage, 」「 25% of the amount, 」and basic attacks instantly generate「 2 / 3.5 / 5.5 (based on level). 」「 50% of the amount. 」 Boomerang Throw can only generate Rage once per cast, and grants Rage based on the first enemy hit. Gnar's Rage decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.

1.text: At maximum Rage, Gnar's abilities are switched to  Mega Gnar's abilities for 4 seconds. Casting one of Mega Gnar's abilities will cause him to transform into  Mega Gnar, else he will transform automatically after the 4 seconds have elapsed.

2.text: Gnar's  Mega form lasts for 15 seconds, with his Rage bar depleting as an indication of remaining time. Rage cannot be generated while in this form. Afterwards, Gnar returns to  Mini Gnar, retaining his  current percentage health and becoming too  tired to generate Rage for 15 seconds.

3.text: Gnar gains different stat bonuses based on whether he is in  Mini or  Mega form. Both of Gnar's forms share their ability cooldowns.

0.text: Innate: Gnar gains  bonus movement speed,  bonus attack range,  attack speed, as well as attack speed growth.

Active: Gnar throws a boomerang in a line in the target direction that deals physical damage to enemies in its path and  slows them for 2 seconds. After reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, the boomerang flies back toward Gnar based on his current movement, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.

1.text: Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while it is returning back  refunds 40% of the ability's maximum cooldown.

0.text: Passive: Gnar's basic attacks  on-hit and abilities apply a stack of Hyper to affected enemies for 3.5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing upon applying the second stack.

1.text: Upon applying 3 stacks to a target, the stacks are consumed to deal bonus magic damage, capped at 300 against  monsters, and grant Gnar 20 / 40 / 60 / 80% (based on  GNAR!'s rank)  bonus movement speed that decays over 3 seconds.

2.text: Gnar gains Hyper's  bonus movement speed when he leaves  Mega form.

0.text: Active: Gnar  leaps to the target location, and upon arrival gains  bonus attack speed for 6 seconds.

1.text: If Gnar lands on a unit he will  bounce 500 units further in the same direction.

2.text: Landing on an enemy deals them physical damage and  slows them by 80% for 0.5 seconds.

3.text: Gnar will not bounce if he is  immobilized, excluding from  sleep(bug), during the first leap.

4.text: Boomerang Throw can be cast during the dash. Hop will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

0.text: Innate: Gnar gains the following increases to his base statistics: 100 − 831 (based on level) base health, 3.5 − 54.5 (based on level) base armor, 3.5 − 63 (based on level) base magic resistance, and 8 − 50.5 (based on level) base attack damage.  Gnar's base stats including these bonuses are provided at the top of Gnar's gameplay article, and will appear separately as Mega Gnar on list articles.

1.text: Gnar restores health equal to the amount gained when transforming into Mega Gnar, but will only retain his current percentage health when returning to Mini form. This Healing is not effected by heal power.

0.text: Active: Gnar throws a boulder in the target direction that stops upon hitting an enemy, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies upon impact and  slowing them for 2 seconds. The boulder then remains on the ground for 6 seconds.

1.text: After 0.3 seconds, Gnar can pick up the boulder by moving within 90 units of it, refunding 70% of the ability's  maximum cooldown.

0.text: Active: Gnar slams his arm down in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck within the area and  stunning them for 1.25 seconds.
Active: Gnar  leaps to the target location and deals physical damage to nearby enemies upon impact. After a 0.25-second delay, additional enemies in a larger radius also take the same damage.

1.text: If Crunch is used to transform, Gnar will still be able to  bounce as per  Hop. Crunch's area of effect is dealt in both areas, though enemies can only be damaged once.

2.text: Enemies Gnar lands directly on top of are affected by Hop's  slow.

3.text: Crunch will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

0.text: Mini Gnar - Passive:  Hyper's  bonus movement speed is increased.

1.text: Mega Gnar - Active: Gnar thrusts his arms in the target direction,  knocking away nearby enemies up to 590 units in that direction, though not through terrain, and afterwards dealing them physical damage, as well as  slowing them by 45% after a 0.4-second delay.

2.text: Enemies that collide with terrain take  50% increased damage instantly and are  stunned instead of  slowed.
